topics.body:
"@Shadow the Hedgehog":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55750a676368727f10001658#post_55750a676368727f10001658
It won't be the same for sure, I feel like there's a few jokes that will be nearly impossible to get quite right in translation

"Like the =="K.Y."== thing in the first Helvetica Standard skit":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xv_eJjJ-VfY

Some subbed versions just change "K.Y." to "clueless," which I guess could work, but it'd still be difficult

By the way, the abbreviation "K.Y." stands for "Kuuki Yomenai," which literally translates to "can't read the air," which basically means you're unable to perceive what is appropriate in a given situation, or you're not able to pick up on subtle social clues.

topics.body:
Another Nichijou joke that might also get lost in translation:

"Straw 1":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oDt0a0qTDa8

"Straw 2":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LgshHNAXSu0

Basically the straw doll is supposed to be a symbol of some kind of threat or curse, but the stuff inside the doll is "Natt≈ç,":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natt%C5%8D a kind of food that's basically just fermented soybeans

So the scene goes from the vice principal seemingly threatening the principal, as it's shown throughout the series that they have a rivalry, but it's just harmless food inside when the principal opens it up
